title: Error on drop TableForeignKey without name
body:
<!--
  Please follow the template.  If you don't, your issue may be closed.

  Have a question?  This is the TypeORM issue tracker - and not the right place
  for general support or questions.  Instead, check the "Support" Documentation
  on the best places to ask questions!

  https://github.com/typeorm/typeorm/blob/master/docs/support.md
-->

## Issue Description
When drop a FK what name was generated by TypeORM (without a name in `TableForeignKey`) the query generated by `dropForeignKey` is setting the FK name as 'undefined'

### Expected Behavior
Generate FK name like method `createForeignKey`
```
 ALTER TABLE "some_table" DROP CONSTRAINT "FK_436590330fb0eee0a7fa10dc49b"
```

<!--
  A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->


### Actual Behavior
Generate 'undefined' FK name

<!--
  A clear and concise description of what actually happened.

  Please wrap any error messages or output in code tags, instead of images.
-->

```
 ALTER TABLE "some_table" DROP CONSTRAINT "undefined"
```


### Steps to Reproduce

<!--
  Your bug will be investigated much faster if we can run your code and it doesn't
  have dependencies other than TypeORM. Issues without reproduction steps or
  code examples may be closed as not actionable.

  Please try to provide a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example.
  http://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve
-->

1. Create a migration what should create a table FK using `TableForeignKey`
2. Run the migration
3. Revert it

```typescript
export class someMigration1664970153005 implements MigrationInterface {
 private readonly table = 'some_table';

  private readonly column = new TableColumn({
    name: 'column_name',
    type: 'int',
  });

  private readonly foreignKey = new TableForeignKey({
    columnNames: [this.column.name],
    referencedColumnNames: ['id'],
    referencedTableName: this.table,
  });

  public async up(queryRunner: QueryRunner): Promise<void> {
    await queryRunner.createForeignKey(this.table, this.foreignKey);
  }

  public async down(queryRunner: QueryRunner): Promise<void> {
    await queryRunner.dropForeignKey(this.table, this.foreignKey);
  }
}
```

### My Environment

<!--
  Please add any other relevant dependencies to this table at the end.
  For example: Electron, React Native, or NestJS.
-->

| Dependency          | Version  |
| ---                 | ---      |
| Operating System    |   Win 10       |
| Node.js version     | 16.14.2 | <!-- run `node -v` to obtain this -->
| Typescript version  | 4.7.4  | <!-- run `npm list typescript` to obtain this -->
| TypeORM version     | 0.3.9  | <!-- run `npm list typeorm` to obtain this -->


### Additional Context
I've tested only in a Postgres DB, others DB Type can has the same issue

<!--
  Add any other context about the bug report here.
-->


### Relevant Database Driver(s)

<!-- Put "yes" instead of "no" to your issue's relevant databases -->

| DB Type           | Reproducible  |
|-------------------| ---           |
| `aurora-mysql`    | no            |
| `aurora-postgres` | no            |
| `better-sqlite3`  | no            |
| `cockroachdb`     | no            |
| `cordova`         | no            |
| `expo`            | no            |
| `mongodb`         | no            |
| `mysql`           | no            |
| `nativescript`    | no            |
| `oracle`          | no            |
| `postgres`        | yes            |
| `react-native`    | no            |
| `sap`             | no            |
| `spanner`         | no            |
| `sqlite`          | no            |
| `sqlite-abstract` | no            |
| `sqljs`           | no            |
| `sqlserver`       | no            |


### Are you willing to resolve this issue by submitting a Pull Request?

 - ‚úÖ Yes, I have the time, and I know how to start.
 - ‚úñÔ∏è Yes, I have the time, but I don't know how to start. I would need guidance.
 - ‚úñÔ∏è No, I don‚Äôt have the time, but I can support (using donations) development.
